cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with scheduling problems and their inapproximability results, which are typically studied in the sub-categories of computer science related to algorithms and complexity theory. Specifically, the paper focuses on the structural hardness of $k$-partite graphs, which is a topic in discrete mathematics and graph theory (cs.DM). The paper also uses techniques from computational complexity theory (cs.CC) to prove inapproximability results for scheduling problems. Additionally, the paper discusses the connection between scheduling problems and game theory (cs.GT) and machine learning (cs.LG), which suggests that these sub-categories may also be relevant.
